alert.note: Alert for Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 9:39AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Burlington. In southeast Pennsylvania...Bucks. * WHEN...Until 1215 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 938 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated the heavy rain due to thunderstorms has ended, although showers will continue for another hour or two. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Trenton, Ewing, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Bordentown, Yardley, Tullytown, Levittown, Woodside, Florence-Roebling, and Morrisville. - This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 6 and 7A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 355 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 39 and 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 54 and 57. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
